properties.title: Energy Projects Transform Trash to Green Power / Landfill gas projects protect health while fueling industry and job creation (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) recognized six landfill methane capture projects and partners for their innovation in generating renewable energy and protecting the climate and people’s health by reducing greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions

properties.title:
EPA and Chrysler to Take Latest Hybrid Technology from Lab to Street/Partnership to adapt fuel efficient technology 
 (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – U.S. Environmental Protection Agency Administrator Lisa P. Jackson and Chrysler CEO Sergio Marchionne today traveled to Ann Arbor, Michigan to announce a cooperative agreement to develop and adapt hydraulic hybrid technology for the light duty auto market

Jackson, and U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) Administrator Karen Mills traveled to Cincinnati, Ohio to announce a new collaborative effort called the Water Technology Innovation Cluster (WTIC)

properties.description: (ATLANTA – Jan. 14, 2011) – On  Jan. 17, 2011, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Regional Administrator Gwen Keyes Fleming will be the keynote speaker at the 41st annual Martin Luther King Jr. Day Celebration at the Fair Street Elementary School in Gainesville, Ga

properties.title: EPA, Schools To Tackle Indoor Air Quality (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON - The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is holding its 11th Annual Indoor Air Quality (IAQ) Tools for Schools National Symposium in Washington, D.C. on January 13-15, 2011

properties.title: EPA Grants Continue to Protect Beachgoers (DC)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is providing almost $10 million in grants to 37 states, territories and tribes to help protect swimmers and beachgoers at America’s beaches

properties.title: JAN 18-19:  Administrator Jackson Travels to Cincinnati, Ann Arbor/Jackson to discuss clean water and emerging environmental technologies (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Administrator Lisa P. Jackson will travel to Cincinnati on January 18 and Ann Arbor, Michigan on January 19 to highlight innovative efforts to protect Americans’ water and air quality and other advances in environmental technologies

properties.title: Two New England Shipyards Cited for Environmental Violations (MA, RI)
properties.description: (Boston, Mass. – Jan. 13, 2011) – Two New England shipyards, one in Massachusetts and one in Rhode Island, will pay penalties to settle claims by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency that they violated federal environmental laws

properties.title: Josh Svaty Selected as Senior Adviser to EPA’s Region 7 Administrator Karl Brooks (IA, KS, MO, NE)
properties.description: Environmental News FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE (Kansas City, Kan., Jan. 13, 2011) - Today, EPA Region 7 Administrator Karl Brooks announced the selection of Josh Svaty, who just served as Secretary of the Kansas Department of Agriculture, to be his senior adviser

properties.title: EPA Administrator, Attorney General to Observe Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Day (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – On Friday, January 14, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency will join other federal departments and agencies in commemorating Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Day. EPA Administrator Lisa P. Jackson will lead the agency’s special commemoration program, and U.S

properties.title: U.S. Announces Clean Air Act Settlement to Protect Indiana Public Health / Northern Indiana Public Service Co. to reduce emissions by more than 64,000 tons annually (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the U.S. Justice Department today announced a global Clean Air Act settlement with Northern Indiana Public Service Co

properties.title: Billerica, Mass. Company Fined for Pesticide Violations (MA)
properties.description: (Boston, Mass. – Jan. 13, 2011) – A Billerica, Mass. company has agreed to pay $526,500 in civil penalties to settle allegations by the U.S

properties.title: Facilities Across the Southeast Ordered to Stop Discharging and Comply with Clean Water Act  (KY, NC, SC, TN)
properties.description: (ATLANTA – Jan. 13, 2011) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) issued Administrative Orders (AOs) against seven entities in North Carolina, Tennessee, Kentucky and South Carolina during the last quarter of 2010 for violations of the Clean Water Act (CWA)

properties.title: Emissions Data from Animal Feeding Operations Study Now Available / EPA also solicits additional information to further understand emissions (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is making data publicly available from a two-year study of air emissions from animal feeding operations (AFOs)

properties.title: EPA Among Sponsors of ScienceOnline2011 (NC)
properties.description: Research Triangle Park, NC-- How can the web and social media be used to promote science? The US Environmental Protection Agency is joining with other science organizations to sponsor ScienceOnline2011, the fifth annual international meeting on Science and the Web

properties.title: Cleanup Scheduled to Begin in Late-January at Hillsborough, N.H. Site  (NH)
properties.description: (Boston, Mass. – Jan. 12, 2011) – In several weeks EPA will begin cleanup work at the Davison site, a one-acre residential parcel on Route 31 in Hillsborough, N.H. in order to remove hazardous materials that could pose risks to people and the environment

properties.title: EPA issues order to Alyeska Pipeline Service in response to Alaska Pipeline leak (WA)
properties.description: (Seattle – Jan. 12, 2011) In order to protect the environment, water quality and wildlife habitat near Alaska’s North Slope, yesterday the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency issued a Unilateral Administrative Order to the Alyeska Pipeline Service Company

properties.title:
EPA to Defer GHG Permitting Requirements for Industries that Use Biomass/Three-year deferral allows for further examination of scientific and technical issues associated with counting these emissions
 (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is announcing its plan to defer, for three years, greenhouse gas (GHG) permitting requirements for carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions from biomass-fired and other biogenic sources

properties.title: EPA Issues Order to NJ Hospital Group (NJ)
properties.description: (New York, NY) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has ordered the Monmouth-Ocean Hospital Corporation (MONOC) to stop applying disinfectants using a fogging system in ambulances

properties.title: Guideco Properties LLC in Monroe Ready for Reuse  (OK)
properties.description: (BATON ROUGE – January 11, 2011) The Louisiana Department of Environmental Quality, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and Guideco Properties LLC, celebrated the completion of a Ready for Reuse project at a ceremony at DEQ today

properties.description: For Immediate Release                No. 11-OPA003 (CHICAGO – Jan. 11, 2011) WHO: Cameron Davis, Senior Advisor to the EPA Administrator (Great Lakes). properties.title: EPA Issues Guidance for Enhanced Monitoring of Hexavalent Chromium in Drinking Water (DC)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – Several weeks ago, EPA Administrator Lisa P. Jackson committed to address hexavalent chromium (also known as chromium-6) in drinking water by issuing guidance to all water systems on how to assess the prevalence of the contaminant

properties.title: EPA Awards $7 Million to Study Effects of Pollution Exposures and Social Stressors on Communities / Research grants aim to gather comprehensive community wide data on human health impacts (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON - As part of the Science to Achieve Results (STAR) research grants program, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has awarded $7 million to fund cumulative human health risk assessment research

properties.title: EPA Seeks Penalty against Company for Illegal Dumping of Brine In Allegheny National Forest Wells (PA)
properties.description: PHILADELPHIA (June 28, 2011) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has proposed a $157,500 civil penalty against a Kansas-based company for alleged illegal discharges of more than 228,000 gallons of oil brine into injection wells in the Allegheny National Forest in McKean County, Pa

properties.title: EPA Seeks Input from Small Entities on Revisions for the Lead and Copper Rule (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON -- The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is inviting small businesses, governments, and non-profit organizations to participate as Small Entity Representatives (SERs) for a Small Business Advocacy Review (SBAR) Panel

properties.title: Take Action on Hot Summer Days to Reduce Asthma Attacks (NY, PR, VI)
properties.description: (New York, N.Y.) Summer is here and the hot weather can cause ozone levels to rise, making the air unhealthy to breathe, especially for people with asthma or other respiratory ailments. On days like today and throughout the hot summer months, it’s important to pay close attention to air quality

properties.title: Take Action on Hot Summer Days to Reduce Asthma Attacks (NJ Edition) (NJ)
properties.description: (New York, N.Y.) Summer is here and today the hot weather has caused ozone levels to rise, making the air in the New Jersey area unhealthy to breathe, especially for people with asthma or other respiratory ailments

properties.title: EPA Accelerates Work at Aerovox, Resumes Eighth Season of Harbor Dredging In New Bedford (MA)
properties.description: (Boston, Mass. – June 28, 2011) – The U.S. EPA has successfully moved ahead of the Aerovox Mill demolition schedule anticipated earlier this year

properties.title: EPA Awards Funds to Cleanup and Revitalize Quincy, Mass. (MA)
properties.description: (Boston, Mass. – June 28, 2011) – As part of $3.5 million in Brownfields grants that EPA is making available for Massachusetts communities, EPA has provided a $200,000 Brownfield cleanup grant to the City of Quincy

properties.title: U.S. EPA fines Van Nuys metal plater $100,000 for hazardous waste violations (CA)
properties.description: (06/29/11) SAN FRANCISCO – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency fined TMW Corporation, 14660 Arminta Street, Van Nuys, $100,000, for violations of the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act

properties.title: EPA Approves Iowa's List of Impaired Waters (IA)
properties.description: Environmental News FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE (Kansas City, Kan., June 29, 2011) - EPA has approved Iowa’s list of impaired waters, which removes 56 waters from the previous impaired waters list and adds 103 waters. Today’s decision brings the total number of impaired waters in the state to 474

properties.title: EPA Update on Yellowstone River Oil Spill (Silvertip Pipeline), July 10, 2011 (MT)
EPA Update on Yellowstone River Oil Spill (Silvertip Pipeline), Week 1 (MT)
properties.description: (Billings, Mont --, July 9, 2011) On July 6th EPA issued ExxonMobil an administrative order instructing them to provide information on the circumstances of the spill, conduct appropriate recovery and remediation actions, and perform ongoing environmental sampling

properties.title: Media Advisory: EPA to hold media availability session on July 9th (MT)
properties.description: Contacts: Matthew Allen, (720) 237-7414; Libby Faulk, (406) 351-9014 (Billings, Mont --, July 8, 2011) EPA will host a media availability session on Saturday, July 9th at 11 a.m

properties.title: July 7 Update on Federal Response to Silvertip Pipeline Oil Spill Near Billings, Montana  (MT)
properties.description: At approximately 11:00 PM on Friday, July 1 a break occurred in a 12-inch pipeline owned by ExxonMobil that resulted in a spill of crude oil into the Yellowstone River approximately 20 miles upstream of Billings, Montana

properties.title: TUESDAY: EPA Chief in Atlanta to Announce National Investments in Green Jobs (GA)
properties.description: (Atlanta – July 8, 2011) On Tuesday, July 12, 2011, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) Administrator Lisa P. Jackson will travel to Atlanta to announce the 2011 national environmental workforce development and job training grant recipients

properties.title: EPA Names DiPasquale Director of Chesapeake Bay Program (DE, DC, MD, NY, PA, VA, WV)
properties.description: PHILADELPHIA (July 8, 2011) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency today announced the selection of Nicholas DiPasquale of Harrington, Del. as the new Director of EPA’s Chesapeake Bay Program

properties.title: Companies in Vermont and Massachusetts face sanctions for failing to prevent oil spills (MA, VT)
properties.description: (Boston, Mass. – July 8, 2011) – A Massachusetts and a Vermont company that each store significant amounts of oil are facing EPA penalties of up to $177,500 for failing to take adequate precautions meant to prevent and contain oil spills

properties.title: EPA Releases New Report on Sewage Pollution in New York and New Jersey (NJ, NY)
properties.description: When it rains, did you ever think about where all that rainwater is going? It flows down storm drains, carrying pollution from the streets, and if it is a heavy rain, causes sewage to overflow into rivers, lakes and streams

properties.title: Here’s What They’re Saying About the Cross-State Air Pollution Rule (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON - Today, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) finalized Clean Air Act protections that will slash hundreds of thousands of tons of smokestack emissions that travel long distances through the air and threaten the health of hundreds of millions of Americans living downwind

properties.title: EPA Extends Public Comment Period on Proposed Remedies for Radford Army Ammunition Plant  (VA)
properties.description: PHILADELPHIA  ( July 7, 2011)  -- The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has extended the public comment period until Aug. 31 on the proposed remedies for cleaning up the Radford Army Ammunition  Plant (RAAP)

properties.title: Georgia Authorized to Implement the Lead Renovation Program (GA)
properties.description: (ATLANTA – July 7, 2011) On July 5, 2011, the State of Georgia received authorization to administer and enforce EPA’s Lead Renovation, Repair, and Painting (RRP) Program

properties.description:
July 6 Update on Federal Response to Oil Spill near Billings, Montana 
At approximately 11:00 PM on Friday, July 1 a break occurred in a 12-inch pipeline owned by ExxonMobil that resulted in a spill of crude oil into the Yellowstone River approximately 20 miles upstream of Billings, Montana

properties.title: Agreement Ensures Removing Contaminated Buildings from Nuclear Metals Superfund Site in Concord, Mass. (MA)
properties.description: (Boston, Mass. – July 6, 2011) – A new agreement will set the stage for more work to occur at a Concord, Mass. Superfund site, including the demolition of contaminated buildings which are unsound and need to be removed. The agreement, an Administrative Settlement Agreement between EPA, U.S

properties.title: Vice President and General Manager of Louisiana Refinery Pleads Guilty to Clean Air Act Violations (LA)
properties.description: (DALLAS – July 6, 2011) Byron Hamilton, 66, vice president and general manager of Pelican Refining Company (PRC), pleaded guilty today to two misdemeanor counts of negligent endangerment under the Clean Air Act

properties.title: EPA Review Finds Coal Ash Ponds at Alliant Energy Corporation in Burlington, Iowa, Meet Safety Standards (IA)
EPA Recognizes Port Arthur ISD and Veolia ES Technical Solutions, L.L.C., for Creating Safer Schools (TX)
properties.description: (DALLAS – July 6, 2011) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) recently partnered with Port Arthur Independent School District and Veolia ES Technical Solutions, L.L.C. to create healthier schools for students and personnel

properties.title: EPA Seeks to Adopt Emission Standards for Large Commercial Aircraft (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON -- The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is proposing to adopt new air pollution standards for engines used primarily in large commercial aircraft, including 737s, 747s, and 767s

properties.title: New Jersey Forest and Farmland To Be Preserved Under EPA Settlement with Home Builder (NJ)
properties.description: (New York, N.Y.) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has reached an agreement with the homebuilder D.R. Horton, LLC for violations of federal regulations that protect against pollution from stormwater runoff. Under the agreement, D.R. Horton will pay a $99,000 penalty

properties.title: EPA Proposes Safeguards for Hazardous Waste Recycling / Action aims to promote economic, environmental and public health benefits of waste recycling  (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is proposing new safeguards for recycling hazardous materials to protect public health and the environment

properties.title: EPA Seeks Public Input on Plan to Clean Up Ground Water at NL Industries Superfund Site in Pedricktown, New Jersey (NJ)
properties.description: (New York, N.Y.) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency today announced a proposed plan to clean up the ground water at the NL Industries, Inc. Superfund site in Pedricktown, New Jersey that is contaminated with heavy metals, including lead and cadmium

properties.title: EPA Region 7 Receives Award for Small Business Contracting Accomplishments (IA, KS, MO, NE)
properties.description: Environmental News FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE (Kansas City, Kan., July 1, 2011) - The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency’s Region 7 has been awarded the Office of Small Business Program Director’s Award in Washington, D.C

properties.title: EPA seeks public comments on revised air quality permits for Shell's Arctic oil exploration activities (AK)
properties.description: (Seattle - July 1, 2011) Today, EPA released draft air quality permits for Shell Oil Company's exploratory oil drilling operations in Alaska's Arctic Outer Continental Shelf consistent with the work schedule that EPA has been pursuing for several months

properties.title: EPA Extends Public Comment Period on Clinton Landfill to Aug. 14 (IL)
properties.description:
For Immediate Release	  
No. 11-OPA060 (CHICAGO – June 30, 2011) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is extending the public comment period on a proposed PCB disposal cell at the Clinton Landfill in Clinton, Illinois, until Aug. 14

properties.title: EPA Approves Two Insecticides for Control of Invasive Stink Bug  (HQ)
EPA Offers Energy Tips on Summer Cooling to Save Money, Reduce Air Pollution (DE, DC, MD, PA, VA, WV)
properties.description: PHILADELPHIA (June 30, 2011) – The summer heat is here. To help you and your family stay cool, comfortable and save energy, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency’s Energy Star program suggests a few simple steps

properties.title: EPA Tips to Be Cool and Safe this Summer / Limit the heat and the sun, but not the fun (HQ)
properties.description: WASHINGTON – The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) is providing tips to protect people from the dangers of overexposure to the sun and heat while still enjoying summer activities. Excessive heat and ultraviolet (UV) radiation are dangerous to people’s health

properties.title: Million Dollar EPA Grant Powers Green Locomotive in Upstate New York (NY)
properties.description: (New York, N.Y.) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency today unveiled upstate New York’s first ultra-low emission locomotive at a railroad yard in Selkirk, N.Y
